Procurement.definition: Manages sourcing, supplier relationships, and purchasing decisions across the organisation.
Procurement.green_skills_focus: Embedding decarbonisation, circular procurement, and ESG supplier performance management.
Procurement.example_green_jobs: Sustainable Procurement Manager, Scope 3 Data Analyst, Circular Supply Chain Lead.
Procurement.risk_of_not_upskilling: Regulatory non-compliance, supply chain disruption, reputational damage, missed cost-saving opportunities.

Finance.definition: Oversees budgeting, financial planning, reporting, investment decisions, and risk management.
Finance.green_skills_focus: Integrating ESG risk assessment, sustainable finance, and climate disclosure capabilities.
Finance.example_green_jobs: Green Finance Analyst, ESG Reporting Lead, Climate Risk Officer.
Finance.risk_of_not_upskilling: Investor disengagement, regulatory penalties, stranded assets, reduced access to capital.

Marketing.definition: Develops and delivers brand, product, and customer communications.
Marketing.green_skills_focus: Green claims compliance, sustainability storytelling, behaviour change communications.
Marketing.example_green_jobs: Sustainability Communications Manager, Purpose-Led Brand Strategist, ESG Content Creator.
Marketing.risk_of_not_upskilling: Greenwashing claims, reputational damage, loss of customer trust, regulatory fines.

IT.definition: Provides technology infrastructure, systems, and data management across the business.
IT.green_skills_focus: Green IT practices, ESG data management, AI for sustainability optimisation.
IT.example_green_jobs: Sustainable IT Architect, ESG Data Platform Manager, AI Sustainability Lead.
IT.risk_of_not_upskilling: Increased digital emissions, data integrity risks, inability to meet disclosure requirements.

Legal.definition: Manages legal risk, compliance, contracts, and governance.
Legal.green_skills_focus: ESG disclosure compliance, green claims defence, climate risk governance.
Legal.example_green_jobs: ESG Compliance Counsel, Climate Risk Legal Advisor, Sustainable Policy Lead.
Legal.risk_of_not_upskilling: Litigation exposure, non-compliance fines, reputational harm, board-level liability.

Supply Chain.definition: Plans, manages, and optimises the flow of goods, services, and materials.
Supply Chain.green_skills_focus: Circular logistics, Scope 3 emissions management, climate resilience planning.
Supply Chain.example_green_jobs: Circular Supply Chain Manager, Net Zero Logistics Lead, Climate Resilience Planner.
Supply Chain.risk_of_not_upskilling: Supply disruptions, regulatory non-compliance, higher costs, reputational damage.

HR.definition: Supports recruitment, talent development, culture, and organisational effectiveness.
HR.green_skills_focus: Green skills training design, sustainability culture building, inclusion in ESG strategies.
HR.example_green_jobs: Green Skills Development Partner, Sustainability Culture Manager, ESG Capability Lead.
HR.risk_of_not_upskilling: Workforce disengagement, talent shortages, failure to embed sustainability culture.

CxO / Executive.definition: Sets strategic direction, governance, and resource allocation for the organisation.
CxO / Executive.green_skills_focus: Climate governance, ESG strategy integration, stakeholder transparency.
CxO / Executive.example_green_jobs: Chief Sustainability Officer, ESG Board Advisor, Net Zero Transformation Leader.
CxO / Executive.risk_of_not_upskilling: Strategic failure, loss of investor confidence, regulatory non-compliance, reputational damage.

Operations.definition: Delivers core production and service processes to meet customer and business needs.
Operations.green_skills_focus: Low-carbon process design, circular operations, climate risk management.
Operations.example_green_jobs: Sustainable Operations Manager, Net Zero Process Designer, Circular Economy Operations Lead.
Operations.risk_of_not_upskilling: Inefficiencies, rising costs, non-compliance, failure to meet decarbonisation targets.

R&D.definition: Innovates products, services, and solutions to drive growth and differentiation.
R&D.green_skills_focus: Sustainable design thinking, lifecycle assessment, regenerative innovation practices.
R&D.example_green_jobs: Circular Product Designer, Regenerative Innovation Lead, Net Positive R&D Manager.
R&D.risk_of_not_upskilling: Product obsolescence, loss of market share, regulatory penalties, stranded assets.

Procurement.description: Has basic awareness of sustainability terms and understands that procurement decisions affect environmental and social outcomes.
Can identify suppliers and categories with sustainability impacts and applies some low-carbon or ethical sourcing considerations.
Consistently integrates sustainability criteria into sourcing, contracts, and supplier relationships.
Leads strategic supplier collaboration, champions circular procurement, and drives innovation in sustainable value chains.

Finance.description: Understands core ESG concepts and recognises that financial decisions influence climate and sustainability outcomes.
Applies basic sustainability principles in budgeting, reporting, and investment reviews.
Integrates ESG risks, disclosures, and decarbonisation considerations into financial strategies and governance.
Drives enterprise-wide sustainable finance, stewards resources for transformation, and champions transparency with investors.

Marketing.description: Recognises customer interest in sustainability and basic risks of inaccurate environmental claims.
Creates messaging that reflects credible commitments and supports brand trust.
Embeds sustainability narratives into campaigns and champions responsible marketing practices.
Shapes brand strategy around sustainability leadership and drives innovation in purpose-led communications.

IT.description: Understands how IT contributes to emissions and recognises the role of data in sustainability.
Tracks digital footprint and supports ESG data collection and reporting.
Leads initiatives to improve energy efficiency, data governance, and digital sustainability practices.
Develops transformative IT strategies that enable enterprise decarbonisation and transparency.

Legal.description: Understands foundational sustainability regulations and the legal implications of non-compliance.
Reviews contracts and disclosures for ESG risks and compliance requirements.
Proactively manages sustainability-related risks and advises on policy and governance frameworks.
Shapes strategic ESG legal guidance, anticipates regulatory trends, and leads on ethical governance.

Supply Chain.description: Recognises climate and circularity issues across the supply chain and their operational impacts.
Applies sustainability criteria to sourcing decisions and tracks supply chain performance.
Leads decarbonisation and resilience initiatives with suppliers.
Designs regenerative, circular supply chains and drives collaborative transformation.

HR.description: Understands sustainability basics and the HR role in building awareness and culture.
Embeds sustainability considerations in training, engagement, and workforce policies.
Leads programmes to build green skills and align HR strategy with organisational sustainability goals.
Champions purpose-driven culture, capability transformation, and sustainable workforce practices.

CxO.description: Recognises sustainability as a strategic priority and understands basic regulatory and stakeholder expectations.
Integrates climate and ESG considerations into leadership decisions and communications.
Drives resource allocation, policy setting, and accountability for sustainability performance.
Champions transformative strategies and industry leadership in sustainability and net zero.

Operations.description: Understands how operational activities impact emissions, waste, and resource use.
Applies sustainability practices in day-to-day operations and tracks improvements.
Leads projects to decarbonise processes and embed circular practices in operations.
Designs and implements operational strategies aligned to regenerative and net zero principles.

R&D.description: Recognises the impact of product and process design on sustainability outcomes.
Integrates basic low-carbon and circular principles into development projects.
Leads sustainable innovation initiatives and life cycle assessments.
Champions breakthrough regenerative solutions and positions sustainability at the core of R&D strategy.

Procurement.action: Including sustainability criteria in RFPs, preferring suppliers with certifications, evaluating total life cycle impact.
Procurement.contribution: Drives emissions reductions, supports ethical practices, and strengthens resilience in the value chain.

Procurement.action: Conducting cradle-to-grave assessments, comparing material options, integrating LCA results into procurement criteria.
Procurement.contribution: Enables informed decision-making and transparent reporting on product footprint.

Procurement.action: Including carbon KPIs in contracts, requiring regular emissions reporting, enforcing consequences for non-compliance.
Procurement.contribution: Aligns suppliers to decarbonisation commitments and ensures accountability.

Procurement.action: Requesting supplier emissions data, verifying against standards, supporting suppliers to improve data quality.
Procurement.contribution: Provides a foundation for accurate carbon accounting and progress tracking.

Procurement.action: Including circularity requirements in tenders, preferring remanufactured products, tracking circular performance metrics.
Procurement.contribution: Reduces waste and resource consumption, supports circular economy goals.

Procurement.action: Preparing supplier GHG inventories, consolidating data for reports, explaining Scope 3 contributions to stakeholders.
Procurement.contribution: Supports transparency and regulatory compliance under frameworks like CSRD.

Procurement.action: Selecting fair trade suppliers, avoiding products linked to deforestation or exploitation, prioritising local sourcing where possible.
Procurement.contribution: Builds trust with stakeholders and protects reputation.

Procurement.action: Publishing sourcing policies, providing feedback to suppliers, reporting progress externally.
Procurement.contribution: Fosters accountability and strengthens supplier relationships.

Procurement.action: Developing action plans for high-impact categories, training teams, engaging in supplier development programs.
Procurement.contribution: Encourages proactive improvements rather than compliance-only approaches.

Procurement.action: Engaging suppliers early on expectations, piloting improvements, sharing forecasts for demand planning.
Procurement.contribution: Reduces disruptions, speeds progress, and demonstrates leadership.

Procurement.action: Conducting periodic reviews, benchmarking against peers, updating policies based on lessons learned.
Procurement.contribution: Ensures progress keeps pace with expectations and innovation.

Procurement.action: Joining industry coalitions, co-creating solutions with suppliers, sharing best practices and resources.
Procurement.contribution: Helps address systemic issues and improves outcomes that no organisation can tackle alone.

Finance.action: Building scenario models, quantifying exposure to carbon pricing, stress-testing assets against climate scenarios.
Finance.contribution: Supports resilience and informed decision-making on investments and allocations.

Finance.action: Including carbon costs in ROI calculations, advising on emissions reduction paybacks, presenting alternative scenarios with carbon pricing.
Finance.contribution: Encourages low-carbon decisions and transparency in financial analysis.

Finance.action: Screening investments for ESG criteria, developing green finance products, monitoring impact KPIs.
Finance.contribution: Positions the business for sustainable growth and stakeholder confidence.

Finance.action: Staying updated on regulations, advising teams on eligibility, integrating principles into investment strategies.
Finance.contribution: Ensures compliance and alignment with evolving expectations.

Finance.action: Preparing climate disclosures, coordinating data collection, validating accuracy with auditors.
Finance.contribution: Avoids legal risk and strengthens investor confidence.

Finance.action: Producing scenario analysis, supporting board reporting, aligning with investor expectations.
Finance.contribution: Demonstrates transparency and readiness for regulatory scrutiny.

Finance.action: Prioritising long-term value creation, questioning short-term trade-offs, advocating responsible investment decisions.
Finance.contribution: Reinforces trust with stakeholders and underpins sustainable performance.

Finance.action: Double-checking ESG data, challenging incomplete narratives, ensuring clarity in sustainability messaging.
Finance.contribution: Protects reputation and ensures compliance with regulations.

Finance.action: Embedding ESG metrics into KPIs, proposing investments that align with purpose, celebrating impact achievements.
Finance.contribution: Enhances engagement and positions finance as a strategic partner.

Finance.action: Reviewing scenarios over 10–30 years, questioning short-term savings that conflict with sustainability, balancing financial and environmental outcomes.
Finance.contribution: Future-proofs the business and builds resilience.

Finance.action: Regularly reporting progress, engaging peers in shared accountability, driving performance improvements.
Finance.contribution: Encourages proactive problem solving and transparency.

Finance.action: Tracking progress against KPIs, addressing gaps quickly, celebrating successes publicly.
Finance.contribution: Builds credibility with investors and stakeholders.

Marketing.action: Verifying claims against evidence, consulting legal teams, updating messaging as needed.
Marketing.contribution: Protects brand trust and ensures compliance with regulations.

Marketing.action: Selecting low-carbon media, using digital channels, measuring campaign footprint.
Marketing.contribution: Demonstrates authenticity and supports decarbonisation targets.

Marketing.action: Confirming certification requirements, training teams, maintaining approvals documentation.
Marketing.contribution: Avoids misleading customers and meets legal obligations.

Marketing.action: Developing case studies, producing videos, aligning messaging to strategy.
Marketing.contribution: Builds credibility and inspires customers to engage.

Marketing.action: Designing calls to action, testing messages, analysing impact data.
Marketing.contribution: Supports decarbonisation and circularity goals through demand shifts.

Marketing.action: Campaigning on reuse schemes, co-creating content with customers, celebrating impact stories.
Marketing.contribution: Helps grow participation in circular models and drives differentiation.

Marketing.action: Reviewing materials carefully, removing exaggerated language, providing clear sourcing information.
Marketing.contribution: Protects reputation and avoids regulatory penalties.

Marketing.action: Publishing supporting data, addressing trade-offs, using neutral language.
Avoiding stereotypes, promoting inclusivity, choosing sustainable partners.
Marketing.contribution: Strengthens purpose-led brand identity and stakeholder loyalty.

Marketing.action: Conducting research, adjusting messaging, responding to feedback.
Running post-campaign reviews, tracking sentiment, acting on feedback.
Subscribing to updates, attending webinars, sharing insights internally.
Marketing.contribution: Keeps marketing relevant and legally compliant.

IT.action: Optimising code, reducing data storage needs, selecting efficient platforms.
IT.contribution: Lowers digital footprint and operational costs.

IT.action: Rightsizing instances, auto-scaling workloads, selecting low-carbon data centres.
Implementing data lifecycle policies, automating deletion, reporting results.
IT.contribution: Reduces environmental impact and boosts performance.

IT.action: Building data pipelines, ensuring data quality, maintaining secure access controls.
Reviewing algorithms, training teams, embedding ethical considerations.
IT.contribution: Reduces risks of bias, privacy breaches, and misuse.

IT.action: Implementing controls, auditing systems, managing incidents effectively.
Selecting responsible vendors, questioning unnecessary growth, prioritising privacy.
Publishing dashboards, reporting progress, explaining methodologies.
Anonymising data, obtaining consents, adhering to regulations.
IT.contribution: Meets legal requirements and earns user trust.

IT.action: Piloting tools, testing prototypes, scaling successes.
Investigating inefficiencies, proposing solutions, collaborating cross-functionally.
Updating roadmaps, reallocating resources, revising targets.
IT.contribution: Keeps IT responsive to evolving needs and regulations.

Legal.action: Including carbon targets, requiring supplier disclosures, defining audit rights.
Legal.contribution: Ensures commitments are enforceable and clear.

Legal.action: Reviewing campaigns, checking substantiation, advising on disclaimers.
Developing procurement policies, updating supplier codes, advising business units.
Tracking regulations, briefing teams, updating policies.
Reviewing reports, advising boards, ensuring consistency.
Legal.contribution: Supports transparency and reduces litigation risk.

Legal.action: Conducting ESG due diligence, flagging risks, advising on warranties.
Legal.contribution: Avoids inheriting liabilities and protects value.

Legal.action: Considering community impacts, balancing interests, advising on ethics.
Refusing shortcuts, challenging non-compliance, documenting decisions.
Legal.contribution: Protects the organisation and maintains credibility.

Legal.action: Advising on inclusive policies, reviewing language, championing access to remedies.
Legal.contribution: Builds stakeholder confidence and reduces risk of discrimination.

Legal.action: Disclosing conflicts, admitting errors, advocating transparent decisions.
Legal.contribution: Protects reputation and sets the tone for the organisation.

Legal.action: Monitoring developments, flagging early warnings, updating risk registers.
Legal.contribution: Enables proactive responses to new threats.

Legal.action: Testing scenarios, consulting experts, playing devil’s advocate.

Supply Chain.action: Mapping emissions by tier, ranking suppliers, updating priority lists.
Supply Chain.contribution: Targets improvement efforts where they matter most.

Supply Chain.action: Selecting electric fleets, optimising routes, consolidating shipments.
Implementing take-back programs, designing for disassembly, managing stock for reuse.
Supply Chain.contribution: Supports circular economy commitments and cost savings.

Supply Chain.action: Learning best practices, sharing case studies, training teams.
Using tools to collect data, verifying accuracy, preparing reports.
Supply Chain.contribution: Supports transparency and compliance with reporting standards.

Supply Chain.action: Conducting risk assessments, modelling scenarios, updating contingency plans.
Using supplier codes, auditing compliance, rewarding leaders.
Supply Chain.contribution: Improves resilience and protects brand reputation.

Supply Chain.action: Monitoring waste, optimising packaging, designing efficient processes.
Selecting certified suppliers, communicating expectations, monitoring labour practices.
Reviewing contingency plans, training teams, building redundancy.
Joining collaborations, co-developing solutions, sharing best practices.
Mapping value chain impacts, identifying leverage points, communicating across functions.
Supply Chain.contribution: Leads to better-informed, more strategic decisions.

HR.action: Workforce mapping, future skills analysis, succession planning.
HR.contribution: Ensures the business has the right capabilities for the transition.

HR.action: Subsidising public transport, offering green pensions, creating wellbeing programs.
Including ESG modules, assigning champions, sharing resources.
Developing training materials, advising managers, measuring progress.
HR.contribution: Equips HR to design effective learning and culture programs.

HR.action: Reviewing regulations, briefing leaders, updating policies.
HR.contribution: Avoids compliance risks and supports proactive action.

HR.action: Linking DEI and sustainability metrics, developing inclusive practices.
Addressing bias, celebrating diversity, promoting psychological safety.
Sharing success stories, aligning goals to purpose, recognising contributions.
Offering flexible working, mental health support, health promotion programs.
Running engagement programs, championing recognition, reinforcing rituals.
Conducting listening exercises, adapting policies, modelling understanding.
HR.contribution: Increases inclusion and quality of solutions.

HR.action: Regular updates, clear expectations, two-way feedback channels.

CxO.action: Leading strategy workshops, aligning goals to purpose, approving investments.
CxO.contribution: Sets the direction and inspires action.

CxO.action: Setting targets, allocating resources, reviewing progress.
Approving green investments, reallocating budgets, supporting pilots.
Reviewing dashboards, approving policies, engaging with stakeholders.
CxO.contribution: Builds trust with stakeholders and ensures compliance.

CxO.action: Regular briefings, scenario planning, engaging with policymakers.
Reviewing reports, ensuring alignment to best practice, briefing investors.
Publicly committing to targets, role-modelling behaviours, storytelling.
Approving long-term investments, challenging short-termism, mentoring leaders.
Advocating for collaboration, addressing supply chain risks, engaging in partnerships.
CxO.contribution: Creates broader positive impact and resilience.

CxO.action: Setting stretch goals, investing ahead of regulation, championing innovation.
Regular reporting, transparent updates, course correcting when needed.
Reviewing progress, updating priorities, reallocating resources.

Operations.action: Upgrading equipment, optimising schedules, tracking energy performance.
Operations.contribution: Cuts costs and supports decarbonisation commitments.

Operations.action: Setting up closed-loop systems, redesigning packaging, specifying recyclable materials.
Operations.contribution: Reduces resource use and aligns with circular economy strategies.

Operations.action: Conducting waste audits, implementing reduction plans, measuring progress.
Operations.contribution: Reduces environmental impacts and regulatory risks.

Operations.action: Creating impact maps, benchmarking performance, sharing insights.
Installing meters, maintaining records, integrating data into reporting.
Operations.contribution: Ensures accurate reporting and supports progress monitoring.

Operations.action: Reviewing requirements, updating procedures, training staff.
Operations.contribution: Avoids legal risks and builds credibility.

Operations.action: Meeting targets, disclosing progress, flagging issues promptly.
Reducing scrap rates, optimising processes, training teams.
Publishing dashboards, sharing lessons learned, updating teams.
Suggesting new ideas, testing pilots, celebrating improvements.
Setting clear expectations, recognising success, addressing gaps quickly.
Operations.contribution: Increases engagement and delivery of targets.

Operations.action: Defining KPIs, tracking impact rigorously, reporting transparently.

R&D.action: Using eco-design tools, specifying low-impact materials, testing prototypes.
R&D.contribution: Drives innovation and aligns with sustainability goals.

R&D.action: Selecting clean technologies, measuring impacts, iterating designs.
R&D.contribution: Enables rapid learning and reduces risks.

R&D.action: Completing LCAs, sharing data with stakeholders, integrating findings.
R&D.contribution: Informs better decisions and supports credible claims.

R&D.action: Developing take-back schemes, designing modular products, using recycled content.
Researching suppliers, testing materials, documenting performance.
R&D.contribution: Enables informed material selection and innovation.

R&D.action: Prototyping clean tech, scaling solutions, measuring benefits.
R&D.contribution: Positions the organisation as a leader in sustainability.

R&D.action: Developing regenerative products, testing closed-loop models, collaborating with partners.
Incorporating scenarios, engaging stakeholders, reviewing legacy impacts.
Documenting impacts, disclosing limitations, updating designs.
Piloting new approaches, asking questions, sharing insights.
Leading pilots, iterating under uncertainty, engaging cross-functional teams.
Running experiments, sharing learnings, pivoting when needed.
